citation.article-title: Two new genera of nocardioform actinomycetes; Amycolata gen. nov. and Amycolatopsis gen. nov.

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis orientalis subsp. lurida nom. rev., comb. nov., subsp. nov.
Amycolatopsis orientalis subsp. lurida (lu'ri.da. L. adj. lurida pale yellow, sallow)

Differs from the Amycolatopsis orientalis type strain in only 4 of 39 characters in the Gordon test series (Table 5) (phosphatase production, lysozyme resistance, acid production from melibiose and rhamnose).

Although Amycolatopsis orientalis subsp. lurida would fall within the definition of Grodon et al. for Amycolatopsis orientalis (13), its DNA exhibited only 46% homology with the DNA of the Amycolatopsis orientalis type strain; therefore, it is included here as a subspecies.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9 (H2, H4).
The type strain produces the antibiotic ristocetin.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 67 mol% (Tm method).
The type strain is strain NRRL 2430.
